website_summaries.verdict: Suitable for 2 people w/a 500 lb. limit. Performance is comparable to a basic hard-shell kayak. We recommend keeping a manual pump on board.
pros: Lightweight and easy to inflate and transport
Can handle up to Class 2 rapids with decent tracking
cons: Design flaw can make boat sit unevenly in water
Removable air bladders are not easy to maintain between uses

customer_reviews.title: Once we got that we love it, Separately we bought an electric air pump
customer_reviews.text: We took it out on the lake for the first time today. It is rocksolid. The only difficulties we had was figuring out how to adjust the seats. Once we got that we love it, Separately we bought an electric air pump, and a manual air pump. The electric makes it easy to inflate the bulk of it. And the hand pump allows you to top it off with just the right amount of pressure. It' is essentially as good as a solid kayak! We love it!.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Doerr

customer_reviews.title: Very nice size, fairly comfortable seats
customer_reviews.text: Very nice size, fairly comfortable seats, but poor design. The inflatable rubber bladders that are the framework of the boat were extremely twisted and it was impossible to get them right. The tracking fin is permanently attached but it’s a bendable rubber, upon arrival the fin was completely bent and it took quite a while to fix it. It was also extremely heavy compared to other inflatable kayaks I’ve used. Ended up returning the boat, cons outweighed the pros.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: We are happy with it
customer_reviews.text: We ordered one kayak and it felt like a cheap pool toy, so we returned it and got this one instead. Its wide enough it doesn't feel like you are going to tip over. It's really sturdy and nice. It's a lot easier to maneuver with one person, but easy enough with two. We bought to take down a large river and didn't have any problems. We fished from it, floated and even had lunch in it. Happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Bostgirl23

customer_reviews.title: or as Comfortable, probably more durable
customer_reviews.text: Honestly not as fast as the Sea Eagle, or as Comfortable, probably more durable, though both have held up well in moderate seas, took them to the Florida Keys, Its also heavier than the Sea Eag, Its really heavy duty if thats what your looking for, hmm mph
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My wife and I love this Kayak
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love this Kayak. We take it out a lot during nice weather on the lake. Very comfortable and maneuverable. Takes about 15 minutes to inflate and away you go. Very sturdy and safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L Moore

customer_reviews.title: glad I bought this one.
customer_reviews.text: really really read long and hard about which inflatable double kayak to buy and LOVE this one (so far! One long weekend outing). We just paddle around, nothing technical, but it inflated well, stayed inflated, and handled well for what we did. It feels durable, and when I saw the other white one I didn't buy, was SO glad I bought this one - it just looks and feels more like an inflatable boat than a pool toy. Can't wait to take it out again.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Not great for long kayak trips
customer_reviews.text: Had to return because it was losing air somewhere. We had all the caps on tight, but could not figure out what was wrong. Another issue with this is that the boat fills with water way to easily. The kayak also feels less sturdy than what we would have liked.
customer_reviews.author: Yenny

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: We were RVing in the Florida Keys, going into withdrawal from lack of a boat. Ordered the Airhead and were able to paddle around to hearts our content. The boat is surprisingly well constructed and fairly comfortable. It doesn't quite handle as good as a hard sided kayak, but it is still very functional.
customer_reviews.author: Butch1980

customer_reviews.title: Orange Boat
customer_reviews.text: Inflatables have strengths and weaknesses compared to rigid hulled watercraft. A strength is that this can be fit into a large duffel bag and stowed in a trunk rather than requiring a rack. The only weakness of this boat would be the tendency to take on some water between the outer shell and the air chambers. This occurs by way of a nylon fabric seam that isn't water tight. The outer hull is a scuff resistant layer more than a water barrier. Draining isn't difficult but it may take a few days of air drying before long term storage.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Kayak manufactured with wrong valve sockets
customer_reviews.text: Help! The kayak was shipped with the wrong "Boston Valve" sizes. The female socket on the left side is larger than the right side however the male plugs are the same size. This was a very frustrating as we did not discover this until we were on our vacation and we could not get the Kayak to hold air. How can I get the correct size plugs?
customer_reviews.author: Jayne Banks

customer_reviews.title: nice ride
customer_reviews.text: I could'nt find anything wrong with it, it inflates easy and has a nice ride for 2 people. A very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Pickering

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: We were quite impressed with this. The lining is very heavy duty and doubled lined. We used it on the river with our dog and we were all comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sanbon

customer_reviews.title: One of the main tubes has a small section defect ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the main tubes has a small section defect and will not inflate. The tube defect would cause a hinge point and the kayak would not function right and could be dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: d jskovac

customer_reviews.title: SUMMER FUN
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THE KAYAK! IT WAS PRETTY EASY TO INFLATE (AS LONG AS THE BLADDERS ARE STRAIGHT INSIDE). WE ARE NOT DEFLATING IT BECAUSE OF THE DIFFICULTY TO INFLATE CORRECTLY. THE ACCESS TO INFLATE THE FLOOR OF KAYAK IS ASKEW AND KIND OF HARD TO ACCESS BUT WE ARE WORKING ON IT!! CAN'T WAIT TO TRY IT ON THE RIVER!! COME ON SUMMER & HEAT!!
customer_reviews.author: becky del

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The Middle did not inflate properly and therefore was too low to work correctly
customer_reviews.author: kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy Kayak
customer_reviews.text: Inflates quick. very stable in the water. Would be hard to flip this thing. The outside cover is really puncture resistant. Sharp branches and rocks do nothing to it. Fits two adults with plenty of room.
customer_reviews.author: MO

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun! Well made!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun! Easy to inflate and deflate. Going down the river is easy, up the river is, of course, work.
customer_reviews.author: Denise  L.

customer_reviews.title: easy to paddle and direct in lakes or mild flowing ...
customer_reviews.text: Very stable, easy to paddle and direct in lakes or mild flowing streams. Good back support while paddling, too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kayak. Easy to set up, fun to use easy storage. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: We love it! Easy to inflate and easy to carry to launch site. Comfortable and maneuvers well. There is a slight learning curve to inflate evenly so that it it not lop-sided.
customer_reviews.author: gb1209

customer_reviews.title: We love the Airhead Montana
customer_reviews.text: We love the Airhead Montana. Easy to Inflate and deflate. We have used it in Catawba River 3 times. Once when the river wash fast and when the water was low.
customer_reviews.author: isaac pentlin

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the money. Durable and well built.
customer_reviews.text: Received this kayak in about 3days. The only con about this kayak was how it was packed in the box. The scag was bent over. I was able to straighten it by heating it with a hair dryer and straighting. It inflated in 10 minutes. Tracked fairly well for an inflatable. Extremely stable and roomy. The seats are confortable as long as you don't fill them up until they're hard. It stayed well inflated even in 35 degree water. It deflated quickly and packs up easily. My wife and I took it for test run and are very satisfied with it. We bought this kayak for its portability. We plan on keeping it in our RV.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great boat! Can easily be packed in the trunk ...
customer_reviews.text: Great boat! Can easily be packed in the trunk and has held up well to a summer of fishing on the lake!
customer_reviews.author: David Mccullough

customer_reviews.title: Nice Kayak when don't want to take up space
customer_reviews.text: I really like this Kayak. Very useful and fun to use. Tracks straight and doesn't require much effort.
customer_reviews.author: Osceogade96

customer_reviews.title: Great deal and quality for an inflatable.
customer_reviews.text: A little bulky in the water, but great for an inflatable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Kayak!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Kayak! We have already taken it out a few times and it is super easy to inflate/deflate. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Cait88

customer_reviews.title: Really nice inflatable
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and settled on this one. It is a great value. Not sure about the durability in whitewater, as I've not tried any yet, but it appears to have very beefy material. The seats are really cool and pretty comfortable, though for me, my lower back does not like it too much (have herniated disc from 10 years ago). Personally, I prefer the canoe for comfort, but it's a tradeoff. This is nice and portable, unlike our old canoe.
customer_reviews.author: Augie

customer_reviews.title: Airhead Inflateable Kayak...Look No Further
customer_reviews.text: Study, great looking, and good in the water!!! We were concerned about this inflatable kayak, but are so glad we got it. We were worried about it easily turning over but grandchidren climbed in and out of it while on the water, and dog even jumped in and still it didn't capsize. Also worried about getting punctures, but that doesn't seem to be a problem either. The boat was dragged up on the dock many times and remains fine. We LOVE the colors and the look of this kayak. It's easy to see on the lake, not like the white ones. The Airhead is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Like it but might have leak can't tell
customer_reviews.text: It inflated really easily and same w deflate. It's heavier than I expected and water was getting in the boat but it may have been how we are using it. I can't tell... I will use it again soon which will tell me for sure
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Real nice portable kayak. looking forward to next summer. love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product, the bladder under has a slow leak ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product, the bladder under has a slow leak right out of the box, contacting the seller about it, but over all quality good. The package comes with stuff assembled incorrectly, etc. Overall quality good not great.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Colorado is a great places to kayak.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal. Not a pool toy at all. Class 3 will perform fine. Inflates in no time.I use the hand pump. Electric pump is a waste of time. Holds pressure all day! 2 people fit easy, with 2 large dry sacks. Deflates in seconds, and stores easy in the back of the SUV.
customer_reviews.author: SliderInside

customer_reviews.title: Solid enough for a dog, light enough for two old people to carry.
customer_reviews.text: After pulling out our backs multiple times loading and unloading our Pelican, we decided enough was enough. This wonderful little kayak has everything that we wanted. The seats are more then comfortable and our backs feel fine after rowing for several hours. The best part is how easy it is to take along. We just throw it deflated into the back of the truck and inflate when we get to where we are going. Piece of cake.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Darnell

customer_reviews.title: Great kayak, I have taken it out twice now ...
customer_reviews.text: Great kayak, I have taken it out twice now on a lake, about to go again this weekend. Conformable for me, (6ft tall) and still fit my dog between my legs well.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: seems very well made but doesn't track worth a darn ...
customer_reviews.text: seems very well made but doesn't track worth a darn, one paddle left, two paddles right. Gonna get a rigid kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: shipped without boston valves and beginner's manual
customer_reviews.text: I received this product in amazon's usual timely manner. However, it was missing the valves to inflate it. It was also missing a manual. It seems that they haphazardly packed up a return or something.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: fun kayak, but....
customer_reviews.text: Took it on the lake once with my 2 children. It was fun and easy to maneuver but after 2 hours both air bladders were fairly deflated,luckily the bottom didn't seem to leak air so we made it back to shore. We'll be sending back to buy a hard shell kayak.
customer_reviews.author: carol wright

customer_reviews.title: tough and fun - we love it
customer_reviews.text: So far we love it. Took it on various small rivers this past summer. Just reviewing now since I saw it again on amazon. We went down one river which was very low. Kept rubbing bottom. Even dragged it over a few. Hardly a scuff. Hard to tip over so kids love it for a ride around the lake. Easy to inflate, deflate and put it. Note though - this is not a superfast kayak. This is slower than a hard one - but that is ok for us.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: I own two.  Perfect for Class I and Class II
customer_reviews.text: Great boats for cruising flat lakes, Class I and IIs. I own two and they've been on the Arkansas and Colorado Rivers. It's best to use an electric pump to get started but you have to finish with a hand pump to get desired pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Darin A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boat
customer_reviews.text: The Montana Airhead Kayak is an excellent boat. It can carry two people very comfortably, much better than the Sevylor Kayak models. I highly recommend it, I am very satisfied with my purchase. Unfortunately, this model does not bring a suitcase to load, only comes with straps to hold it, which is useful but not very comfortable. Kayak is a lightweight, very easy to carry, and performs excellent in lakes, rivers and even the sea with moderate water.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Jaramillo

customer_reviews.title: Nose cap tore off the first time it was used
customer_reviews.text: This kayak was a handful, it's not particularly light, and it takes on a ton of water even on a calm lake. It doesn't track straight, at all. After the first use, while packing it up the cover for the nose tore off, which makes it completely useless. It would just suck water straight into the boat if I tried to use it again. Back it goes!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: What size bag do I need to hold this kayak ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought the kayak small, which held our kayak, 2 paddles, 2 life vests, air pump, and wet bags:
customer_reviews.author: Brad J Helgason

customer_reviews.title: Great kayak
customer_reviews.text: I used this with my grandsons - great kayak - well built, strong. I'll carry it on my 5th wheel for fun options on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Harris

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price.
customer_reviews.text: not the highest quality but seems to work. I would not use this in whitewater.
customer_reviews.author: chad

product_meta.title: Airhead Montana Kayak Two Person Inflatable Kayak
product_meta.description:
Airhead Performance Travel kayaks. Inflatable kayaks are perfect for camping, vacationing, exploring remote areas, and cruising yachts. They're also great for paddling enthusiasts that don't want to drive around with a kayak on their rooftop! AIRHEAD Travel Kayaks fit easily into the trunk of your car, duffel bag or suitcase. When you feel the itch to paddle, your boat is with you! Designed for lakes and moderate white water, this kayak is lightweight, compact, and portable. Includes inflatable seats with adjustable support backrest with a mesh pocket. Made in highly visible orange for safety. Low drag / superior tracking with 4 bottom fins. All 3 air chambers are completely enclosed by rugged 840-denier nylon with UV and water-resistant coatings. Durable tri-laminate reinforcements on the bottom for a lifetime of use. Neoprene elbow guards for comfort when paddling. Easy to inflate and deflate (3 Boston valves with nylon covers). Stainless steel and nylon hardware will not corrode. 6 D-rings at bow and stern for securing gear, Stretch net in bow Low drag, superior tracking Grab handles for easy put-ins and pull-outs Threaded drain plug . 2 person inflatable kayak includes carry handles on the side for transporting into the water.

AMAZON.COM
Inflatable kayaks are perfect for camping, vacationing, exploring remote areas, and cruising yachts. They're also great for paddling enthusiasts that don't want to drive around with a kayak on their rooftop! This 12-foot travel kayaks fits easily into the trunk of your car, duffel bag or suitcase. When you feel the itch to paddle, your boat is with you. Tubular I-beam floor supports the boat for superior comfort, buoyancy, and tracking and is made of high-visibility orange PVC for extra safety on the water. 





The Travel Kayak seats 2 comfortably for on-water fun. Features:  * 12-foot, 2-man inflatable kayak individuals; more spacious than 10-foot model 
 * Designed for lakes and moderate white water 
 * Lightweight, compact, portable 
 * Highly visible orange for safety 
 * Semi-rigid heavy gauge PVC construction 
 * Tubular I-beam floor for superior comfort, buoyancy and tracking 
 * Spray covers fore and aft 
 * Movable and removable inflatable seats provide great back support 
 * 2 Boston valves for quick inflating & deflating 
 * Threaded drain hole with plug 
 * Designed for lakes and moderate white water 
 * Lightweight, compact and portable 
 * Semi-rigid, heavy-gauge PVC construction 
 * Front and back spray covers 
 * Low drag and superior tracking with 4 bottom fins 
 * All 3 air chambers are completely enclosed by rugged 840-denier nylon with UV and water-resistant coatings 
 * Durable tri-laminate reinforcements on the bottom 
 * Neoprene elbow guards for comfort 
 * Easy to inflate and deflate 
 * Stainless steel and nylon hardware will not corrode 
 * 6 D-rings at bow and stern for securing gear, stretch net in bow 
 * Low drag, superior tracking 
 * Grab handles for easy put-ins and take-outs 

 Specifications: 

 * Capacity: 2 
 * Length: 12 feet 
 * Weighs: 36.3 pounds 
 * Weight Capacity: 500 pounds
feature_bullets: Airhead Montana Travel kayaks are Inflatable kayaks that are perfect for camping, vacationing, exploring remote areas, and cruising yachts
All 3 air chambers are completely enclosed by rugged 840-denier nylon with UV and water-resistant coatings
Made with Neoprene elbow guards for comfort when paddling and a stretch net in the bow and 6 D-rings at bow and stern for securing gear
Bright orange inflatable kayak for safety and visibility on the water
Designed for lakes and moderate white water, this two person inflatable kayak is lightweight, compact, and portable
